choices: Anything that has mass and takes up space
items.explain: Matter has mass and volume. Light and sound are not matter.

items.prompt: The smallest unit that keeps the properties of an element is a:
items.explain: An atom is the basic unit of an element.

items.prompt: Where are protons found in an atom?
items.explain: Protons and neutrons are in the nucleus.

items.prompt: What is the charge of an electron?

items.explain: Oxygen is made of one type of atom.

items.prompt: A compound is best described as:
choices: Two or more elements chemically bonded in a fixed ratio
Two or more substances mixed in any ratio
A substance that can be separated using a filter
items.explain: Compounds have chemical bonds and a fixed composition.

choices: A combination of substances not chemically bonded
A substance made of one element only
A new substance formed by a reaction
items.explain: Mixtures are physical combinations, not new substances.

items.prompt: Which example is a homogeneous mixture?
items.explain: A homogeneous mixture looks uniform throughout.

items.prompt: Which method is best to recover salt from saltwater?
items.explain: Evaporation removes the water and leaves salt behind.
